101.title: A crash course on Google Cloud AutoML and machine learning APIs
101.description: Thanks to machine learning and AI, applications are now being created that can see, hear, and understand the world around them. Learn how you can easily infuse AI into your business today. In addition to a guided walkthrough of easy-to-use machine learning APIs from Google Cloud: Cloud Vision, Cloud Video Intelligence, Cloud Speech, Cloud Natural Language, and Cloud Translation, we'll demonstrate how Google Cloud AutoML enables developers with limited machine learning expertise to train high quality models by leveraging Google’s state of the art transfer learning, and Neural Architecture Search technology.

102.title: Effective Code Review
102.description: Code Reviews are essential in every software team on any size. It allows teams to share knowledge, onboard people to the code base and most importantly keep the quality coherent. In this talk, after briefly defining code review, we will talk about how to make code reviews effective. The talk will consist of best practices from the eyes of the code author and code reviewer.

103.title: Google Assistant powered by Containers, Machine Learning and .NET on Google Cloud
103.description: What does it take to connect Google Assistant to the cloud? Surprisingly, not much! In this talk, we will create a Dialogflow app to get Google Assistant to talk to a container managed by Kubernetes/App Engine. In the container, we’ll use some of the Machine Learning APIs and BigQuery and see how they can elevate our Google Assistant app to the next level. We will also integrate with Stackdriver and see how you can get more insights about your app with HTTP tracing and live debugging features of Stackdriver.

104.title: Google Pay and The Future of Online Payments
104.description: Online payments have changed and they keep changing, pushing conversions higher and making businesses grow. See how Google Pay can help your company.

105.title: How I become a mobile developer with Firebase and Flutter
105.description: As a software developer, you would be probably interested in building mobile apps: not sure if Android or IOS? Why not both with Flutter! Flutter is Google’s mobile app SDK for creating high-quality native interfaces for iOS and Android in record time, is free and opensource. During this talk, we are going to explore this framework and how you can combine it with Firebase to boost your app even more.

106.title: Living on a green rocket field
106.description: At Google IO 2018 the Android team announced Jetpack for Android, which is an opinionated set of libraries and architecture, which is a recommendation for Android developers. We at LAB1886, the incubator for the Daimler AG (Mercedes Benz), thought to give it a try with our latest project called RaceScout from AMG. We have the luxury to work always on green fields for projects. So, we wanted to share our experience with Jetpack and also give some recommendations for all the library & SDK developers.

107.title: Customizing with Material Theming
107.description: At Google I/O 2018, Material Design announced new capabilities to customize app components and styles through theming. This talk will provide an overview of Material Theming, updates to the design system, and new tools to support the design to development workflow.

108.title: Micro Frontends Architecture
108.description: I will be talking about what micro-frontends is and how to implement it using NodeJs with examples.

109.title: What's new at Google platform
109.description: Latest platform products such as Flutter, Nougat, AoG, Cloud

110.title: TBA - will be about iOS - Swift
110.description: TBA - will be about iOS - Swift

111.title: Episode IV: Return of the Flutter
111.description: Is Flutter the next big thing in developing multi platform apps with a single codebase. Google seems to think so. So let's try this out by making a Star wars movies app. And see if we can make that run on both Android and IOS by using the Flutter Framework.

112.title: Getting started with Flutter and Firebase
112.description: This workshop is for the developers who have a Flutter app and want to add Firebase to it, or already using Firebase and want to learn how to build a native mobile app using Flutter.

113.title: Develop and write better software using Apache NetBeans IDE
113.description: NetBeans IDE is the leading open source solution for writing high quality software. Available for free and Open source, it provides a complete solution to create, test and ship software in multiple languages including Java, JavaScipt, C and PHP. It includes numerous features to spot errors and write good quality code. It is highly configurable and also forms an excellent learning platform for beginners while providing an ideal solutions for professionals. And if you do not like the way it works or miss a feature, you can even hack the IDE itself. If you are learning to code or looking for a more productive way to write your code, come along to our talk and find out what NetBeans has to offer.

114.title: Introduction to Machine Learning on Google Cloud Platform
114.description: There are revolutionary changes happening in hardware and software that are democratizing machine learning (ML). Whether you're new to ML or already an expert, Google Cloud Platform has a variety of tools for users.

115.title: RxJava ve Kotlin Coroutines, Kullanim senaryolari
115.description: RxJava bir çok kullanımı olan güçlü bir araç. Asenkron işlem ve fonksiyonel programlamanın bir çok öğesini kullanıma sunuyor. Fakat Kotlin fonksiyonel programlama özelliklerini şimdiden, Asenkron işlemleri kolaylaştıran ve ucuzlaştıran Coroutine'leri 1.3 versiyonu ile sağlıyor. RxJava ve Kotlinin bu özelliklerinin karşılaştıracağım.

116.title: Applied Machine Learning at Scale
116.description: In this session we will describe details of Machine Learning technologies used in Turkey's #1 mobile entertainment App and the Research&Development process that lead to its success. Highly scalable cloud-based Deep Learning application automates processing of millions of images per day to prevent fraud and malicious user behavior, as well as reduce network and total operation costs.

117.title: HOW TO MESS UP YOUR ANGULAR UI COMPONENTS
117.description: This talk covers how to create rich UI components with Angular following the best practices and avoiding the pitfalls. For each practice, a real-life example from PrimeNG will be used as a case-study such as change detection techniques, templating, rxjs, state management, integrating 3rd party libraries, styling, querying and effective dom handling.

118.title: My Journey of Building Robots
118.description: My journey first started when I was 8 years old and we lost our family dog, Korsan. I was really upset and missed him so much I decided I wanted to bring one of my soft toys to life. I asked my Dad's mechanical engineer friend how to make it. Since then I am working on building robots of purpose. I  am learning to code in Python, Javascript, and Ruby. Upto today I have completed 3 robotic projects in all of them I used Arduino and wrote codes in Arduino IDE and two of the projects include mobile application for Android which is made in App Inventor 2. Now I am working on upgrading my award winning Robot Project iC4U. In this version I am using Raspberry Pi and Google's AIY - Project Bonnets (voice and vision) which will add direct voice command and image processing capabilities to my robot.

119.title: Mobil uygulamalrda AR
119.description: Mobil uygulamalarda AR teknolojilerinin kullanım yerleri ve Android Kütüphanelerinin kullanımı

120.title: Building serverless applications with Google Cloud
120.description: Google is thinking differently about what it means to be Serverless. In this session, you'll learn what serverless means to us as we deep dive into Google Cloud Platform Serverless services.

121.title: Big Data Solutions by GCP
121.description: Capture real-time vehicle sensor data for analytics and visualization : Will be pushing test data into pub/sub, streaming pipeline using data flow and push data into BQ. Average speed and current speed transforms will be done in Dataflow. Finally will visualize and create reports in Data studio. If time permits, I will also show how to predict vehicle speed using Bigquery ML.

123.title: Peer-to-Peer Video Distribution with WebRTC
123.description: In this talk, we will go into detail of our large-scale P2P video content distribution system using WebRTC. We will briefly introduce WebRTC, then delve into some of the challenges we have encountered and the technical solutions we developed. These include: Low upload rates, mobile uploads having quotas, live streams requiring low latency, matching optimal peers, protecting users from fake data, and scaling to millions of concurrent users.
